title: Can Riot detect whether we've been disconnected by a power outage?
body: Because I lost power for almost an hour and I hope I wasn't reported for that. -.-

replies.body: no, you kill all LOL processes from command prompt to appear like you got a power outage, or you can just disconnect your modem.
Lol that'd be dumb. I'd wish they could like check up on local services and tally how many players had the same issue based on reports/complaints/posts if it ever did get out of hand.
When they find alot of DCs from their end, i.e. server failure, ISP bullshit from TPG they give loss forgivens that dont count towards win-loss record or LP loss from ranked games.
Yeah, lame...but not super important. Just a damn hassle. Freaking storm/tree. Pwned my match.

More often then not, Riot simply can't determine why a person has DCed (short of a person opening the menu and clicking the "leave" button). Not to mention, it wouldn't work very well if they could as such a system would be easily abusable (like Buttsubushi said, kill all processes/tun off modem/turn off computer would show as "seemingly unintentional").

Even if you did get reported, you should be fine. It takes more than one match (even if reported by 9 people in that match) for leavebuster to take *any* action, except (perhaps) in extreme cases. The leavebuster system accounts for occasional unintentional disruptions that the average person might experience, and in my experience it works just fine (I've probably racked up 1-2 dozen "leaves" from things out of my control over the 3+ years I've been playing and have never been punished).
I can relate to the feeling of panic that comes over you when your power outs and you're mid game. As long as you haven't racked up too many leaves in a short while you'll be fine.
